255550004.Tooltip: Universities and colleges (e.g., private universities and colleges, public degree-granting colleges, public degree-granting universities, public community colleges and vocational schools), foundations, and other educational institutions/school board (public and private), agriculture-based academic institutions, non-for-profit research institutions, research centers, institutions, organizations (i.e., diversification centers), or associations, knowledge transfer and exchange centers, support agencies for research initiatives, circumpolar research organizations, educators/teachers, veterinary colleges (public and private institutions), national researcher, research station.

255550006.Tooltip: agri-business service provider (e.g., feed mills), custom applicators, auctions, animal health practitioner (e.g., veterinaries), industry service providers, grain storage and elevators, external consultants (i.e., business consultant, human resource consultant), agricultural network consulting, food distributor, auction mart, assembly yard, watershed districts, direct food contract packaging manufacturer, farrier, food distributor, livestock transporter, community councils, sheep shearer, direct food contact packaging manufacturer, food distributor, livestock transporter, veterinarian or animal health technician,  equipment providers, equipment maintenance services, food processing (processor) services, husbandry, AI services, animal health provider/services, veterinary clinics, workforce planning boards, brewpubs

255550007.Tooltip: Government departments, crown corporations, school districts, school board. Municipal: RCM (regional, county, municipality), government departments, municipalities, other government bodies (e.g., municipal districts including counties, hamlets, special areas, specialized municipalities, and improvement districts).

255550008.Tooltip: Indigenous businesses, communities, and organizations (e.g., Industry organization: Producer organization, Processor organization, other industry organization), includes not-for-profit organization and for-profit organization, other Indigenous groups undertaking agricultural initiatives, government, Indigenous self-government, Tribal Councils, associations, Political Territorial Organizations (PTOs).

255550009.Tooltip: A student pursuing a post-secondary education in agriculture who applies for the Agriculture Student Scholarship through the ministry and receives funds directly to go towards their studies.

DeclarationAndConsentStep.Field: A field on the Declaration And Consent step

fields.name: quartech_legalbusinessororganizationname
fields.tooltipText: For a partnership, it is the names of the partners or the name the business was registered under with provincial or territorial authorities (e.g., farm name or if none provided use 'First name Last name'). For a corporation, it is the name that appears on the certificate of incorporation.

fields.name: quartech_question2regoverningboard
fields.tooltipText: Indigenous governing body would include entities such as a band or tribal council, government of a self-governing First Nation or Métis Nation Chartered Community.

fields.name: quartech_indigenoussharepercentage
fields.tooltipText: Only select this option if you are not able to, or prefer not to select a specific Indigenous identity. Do not double count with other Indigenous identities above.

fields.label: Type of Business / Organization. If your operation does both processing and primary production, please select the one that will primarily benefit from this program.

fields.name: quartech_annualgrossrevenueoverlimit
fields.label: Did you report total annual gross revenues greater than $50,000/year in the previous year to Canada Revenue Agency? - This eligibility requirement may not be applicable to Indigenous applicants.

fields.name: quartech_areyouapplyingforatraceabilityknowledget
fields.tooltipText: Some examples of Traceability Knowledge Transfer events include: Importance of traceability in sustainable business strategies and how it can improve food safety, risk management and scalability of business; Current and emerging technologies and resources in addressing food fraud; Traceability and best management practices for small farms; Hands-on demonstration and training session with vendor(s) on the use of dedicated traceability software and equipment. For more information about the Traceability Knowledge Transfer program, please visit: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/industry/agriculture-seafood/programs/bc-traceability-funding-programs.

fields.name: quartech_proposedactivitystopicpurposeintent
fields.tooltipText: Keep in mind that you will be asked to measure outcomes in your post-project report

fields.name: quartech_accessandinclusivenessdescription
fields.tooltipText: For more information about planning for inclusive activities, please refer to the Program Guide.

fields.name: quartech_theprocessoflearningandprocessingknowledge
fields.tooltipText: The Province would like to see funded activities incorporate adult learning principles and techniques to increase the project’s success in transferring knowledge to attendees. For more information, please refer to the Program Guide.

fields.name: quartech_advertisingcommunications
fields.tooltipText: All promotional material must be reviewed by the Province. Please plan to submit your promotional material at least two weeks in advance of promoting your event

fields.name: quartech_administrationcosts
fields.tooltipText: Administrative costs must not exceed 10% of the Total Funding Required from KTTP (not Total Project Cost)
